textAttribute.name: ec_number_warning
textAttribute.text: Warning: some EC numbers are computationally inferred by orthology. Examine the evidence in the 'EC Numbers (scores for computational inference)' table below. Also, explore this gene's ortholog group at OrthoMCL: $$orthomcl_link$$

textAttribute.name: ec_num_warn
textAttribute.text: Warning: pathway assignment is based on EC numbers, some of which are computationally inferred by orthology. See Function prediction above.

textAttribute.name: ec_inferred_description
textAttribute.text: This gene's protein sequence was compared to the protein sequences of other genes in the same ortholog group. The gene is inferred to receive a specific EC number based on how well the sequence matches genes that have been previously assigned this EC number.

textAttribute.name: alphafold_table_help
textAttribute.text:
VEuPathDB uses UniProt IDs to associate AlphaFold predictions with genes.

In some cases where specific organisms or genes are not in UniProt, associations between genes and UniProt entries have been made by sequence similarity. This may result in multiple UniProt IDs mapping to a gene.

In these cases, we have selected a representative structure to show on this page. Where possible, this is a direct UniProt entry. Where only associations using sequence similarity are available, we have shown the longest prediction. The entry for the representative structure is indicated in the "is visualization" column.

table.name: pberANKA_phenotype_Bushnell_functional_profiling_RSRC_Phenotype
table.description:
Note:
  • Dispensable: 95% confidence interval includes a relative growth rate of 1.0
  • Essential: 95% confidence interval includes a relative growth rate of 0.1
  • Slow: 95% confidence interval indicates a relative growth rate between 0.1 and 1.0
  • Fast: 95% confidence interval indicates a relative growth rate greater than 1.0

table.name: pknoH_phenotype_piggyBac_mutagenesis_HME_MIS_OIS_RSRC
table.displayName: P. knowlesi H essential genes via piggyBac screen

table.name: pknoA1H1_phenotype_piggyBac_mutagenesis_MIS_MFS_RSRC
table.displayName: P. knowlesi A1H1 essential genes via piggyBac screen

table.name: TranscriptionSummary
table.description:
Summary of expression values. Each row represents a distinct RNA-Seq experiment. Click to read more...
  • Each black dot represents expression in a sample. A boxplot is shown, with the box representing the median and upper/lower quartiles, and the whiskers representing the max/min values (or 1.5 times the interquartile range, in which case values beyond the whiskers are considered outliers).
  • Hover over the experiment name to show a table of sample names and values.
  • Click on a boxplot to show labels and values for each sample in an experiment. Click again on the boxplot to hide labels and values. A button at the bottom-right removes labels and values for all experiments.
  • Use the toggle button at the bottom-left to switch from Log Scale to Linear Scale.
  • Log Scale values are log2(TPM+1) for these reasons:
    1. TPM+1: to de-emphasize low noisy TPM values (i.e., <1).
    2. log2: so that each unit on the x-axis represents a 2-fold difference.
  • Navigation buttons appear at the above-right when hovering over the graph. If the buttons do not appear, reload the page.
  • Zoom in with the navigation button or click and drag within the graph. Zoom out with the navigation button or double-click within the graph.
  • This graph was created with Plotly. Get more help at their website.

table.name: ExpressionGraphs
table.description: Datasets that monitor transcript levels using RNA-Seq (RNASeq or RNA Sequencing) or DNA microarrays.

table.name: UserDatasetsTranscriptomicsGraphsDataTable
table.displayName: User Datasets Transcriptomics Graphs Data Table

table.name: InterPro
table.description: The InterPro family of databases includes CATH, CCD, HAMAP, PANTHER, Pfam, PIRSF, PRINTS, PRODOM, PROFILE, PROSITE, SFLD, SMART, SUPERFAMILY, TIGRFAMs. The InterPro database used may not be the latest version; to view the version used, press 'Data sets'. To run an analysis using the current version, see the InterProScan section below.

table.name: Plasmo_eQTL_Table
table.displayName: Regions/Spans associated by eQTL experiment on HB3 x DD2 progeny (LOD cut off = 1.5)

columnAttribute.name: ec_number
columnAttribute.help: Enzyme Commission classification of enzyme based on the reactions they catalyze

columnAttribute.name: ec_description
columnAttribute.help: Enzyme Commission classification description of this assignment

columnAttribute.name: ec_source
columnAttribute.help: The source of this EC assignment.

linkAttribute.name: ec_number_link
linkAttribute.help: Enzyme Commission classification of enzyme based on the reactions they catalyze

columnAttribute.name: ec_number
columnAttribute.help: Enzyme Commission classification of enzyme based on the reactions they catalyze

columnAttribute.name: length_score
columnAttribute.help: How well the protein length matches the length of proteins that were previously assigned this EC number. 4 is the best score.

columnAttribute.name: blast_score
columnAttribute.help: Using BLAST, how well the protein sequence matches the sequences of proteins that were previously assigned this EC number. 4 is the best score.

columnAttribute.name: domain_score
columnAttribute.help: How well the ordered set of domains within this protein matches the ordered set of domains within proteins that were previously assigned this EC number. 4 is the best score.

columnAttribute.name: num_protein_with_ec
columnAttribute.help: Number of proteins in this ortholog group that were previously assigned this EC number.

columnAttribute.name: num_protein_in_group
columnAttribute.help: Number of total proteins present in this ortholog group.

columnAttribute.name: num_genera_with_ec
columnAttribute.help: Number of genera in this ortholog group that were previously assigned this EC number.

columnAttribute.name: num_genera_in_group
columnAttribute.help: Number of total genera present in this ortholog group.

table.name: ProteinProperties
table.help: Protein Browser (JBrowse) view of protein structure prediction, domain prediction and protein features including isoelectric point, molecular weight, Signal peptide (SignalP) domain, length, sequence, transmembrane domains (TMHMM), InterPro domains, predicted export domains, hydropathy plot, low complexity regions, PSIPRED Helix, Strand and Coil predictions.
table.description: Protein Browser (JBrowse) view of protein structure prediction, domain prediction and protein features including isoelectric point, molecular weight, Signal peptide (SignalP) domain, length, sequence, transmembrane domains (TMHMM), InterPro domains, predicted export domains, hydropathy plot, low complexity regions, PSIPRED Helix, Strand and Coil predictions.

table.name: ProteinExpressionPBrowse
table.displayName: Mass Spec.-based expression evidence in Protein Browser
table.description: Proteomics data displayed as mapped peptides in the protein browser (JBrowse). Hover over or click a peptide for more details.

table.name: Sequences
table.description: View and copy the protein, mRNA and genomic sequences for each transcript of this gene. A FASTA header is included in the copy. To download a FASTA or GFF file, use the 'Download Gene' link at the top of this page.

columnAttribute.name: ontology
columnAttribute.help: Top level ontology term for this GO ID

columnAttribute.name: is_not
columnAttribute.help: NOT is used to make an explicit note that the gene product is not associated with the GO term.

columnAttribute.name: source
columnAttribute.help: VEuPathDB obtained the gene-to-GO term association from this resource (e.g. GeneDB) or tool (e.g. InterPro).

columnAttribute.name: evidence_code
columnAttribute.help: The evidence code reflects the type of work or analysis described in the cited reference which supports the association of the GO term to the gene product. More information on evidence codes can be found on http://www.geneontology.org/page/guide-go-evidence-codes.

columnAttribute.name: reference
columnAttribute.help: The reference indicates the source, such as a publication or database record, that is cited as an authority for the association of GO term to the gene product. If the source is GeneDB, then the reference is manually assigned by curators.

columnAttribute.name: evidence_code_parameter
columnAttribute.help: The data record that supports the assignment of the GO term evidence code to the gene product.

columnAttribute.name: ontology
columnAttribute.help: Top level ontology term for this GO ID

columnAttribute.name: is_not
columnAttribute.help: NOT is used to make an explicit note that the gene product is not associated with the GO term.

linkAttribute.name: slim_go_id_link
linkAttribute.help: The GO Slim ID correlates with the GO ID that is assigned to the gene. GO Slim is a subset of terms from GO that provide a broader overview of the ontology content. VEuPathDB uses GO Slim Generic. Column entries link to more detailed descriptions for the GO ID/Term.

columnAttribute.name: slim_go_term_name
columnAttribute.help: The GO Slim Term Name describes the property of the GO Slim ID . GO Slim is a subset of terms from GO that provide a broader overview of the ontology content. VEuPathDB uses GO Slim Generic. Column entries link to more detailed descriptions for the GO ID/Term

textAttribute.name: LOPITGraphSVG
textAttribute.text: The red line represents the outlier probability while the error bars show standard deviations

columnAttribute.name: location
columnAttribute.help: The most likely steady-state protein location

columnAttribute.name: probability_MAP
columnAttribute.help: The modal probability of the protein to belong to the subcellular class and not being an outlier

columnAttribute.name: location
columnAttribute.help: The most probable subcellular locations with the average component probability above 0.05

columnAttribute.name: probability_MCMC
columnAttribute.help: The average probability of belonging to a subcellular component. Compare to the outlier probability given in the first line

columnAttribute.name: location
columnAttribute.help: The most likely steady-state protein location

columnAttribute.name: probability_map
columnAttribute.help: The modal probability of the protein to belong to the subcellular class and not being an outlier

table.name: AllProducts
table.description: This table provides a list of product descriptions from all relevant sources. The most commonly accepted product description also appears at the top of this gene page.

columnAttribute.name: evidence_code
columnAttribute.help: The evidence code reflects the type of work or analysis described in the cited reference.

columnAttribute.name: reference
columnAttribute.help: The reference indicates the source, such as a publication or database record, that is associated with the gene product description.

columnAttribute.name: assigned_by
columnAttribute.help: The Assigned By denotes the original source of the annotation (e.g. data repository, community curation or a third party resource).

table.name: ApolloProducts
table.description: Annotations are derived from gene models in Apollo where an annotator has added additional functional information. To view or edit the annotations, press the "Annotate in Apollo" button above on this page.

columnAttribute.name: exact_match
columnAttribute.help: Is one of the EC numbers associated with this gene an exact match with the EC number for this reaction? An example of an inexact match is a gene annotated with 1.2.3.4 matching an enzyme in a pathway annotated as 1.2.-.-

textAttribute.name: alphafold_url
textAttribute.help: The most probable structure for this protein as predicted by AlphaFold.
textAttribute.text:
VEuPathDB uses UniProt IDs to associate AlphaFold predictions with genes.

In some cases where specific organisms or genes are not in UniProt, associations between genes and UniProt entries have been made by sequence similarity. This may result in multiple UniProt IDs mapping to a gene.

In these cases, we have selected a representative structure to show on this page. Where possible, this is a direct UniProt entry. Where only associations using sequence similarity are available, we have shown the longest prediction. A full list of AlphaFold predictions putatively associated with this gene is available in the AlphaFold table above.

Key:
AlphaFold structures are colored using a per-residue confidence metric called pLDDT, which is scaled from 1 - 100.

  Very high (pLDDT > 90)   Confident (90 > pLDDT > 70)   Low (70 > pLDDT > 50)   Very low (pLDDT < 50)

Loading graphics...

textAttribute.name: GeneModelGbrowseUrl
textAttribute.help: Details of the annotated gene model viewed in the genome browser (JBrowse). Also shown are community annotations, introns predicted via RNA-Seq analysis and a plot that combines all integrated RNA-Seq evidence.

textAttribute.name: SyntenyGbrowseUrl
textAttribute.help: Details of the VEuPathDB synteny analysis results including a genome browser (JBrowse) view of synteny in the region of this gene. Organisms are represented with 'gene' and 'span' tracks, while shadows between the tracks represent orthology between organisms.

textAttribute.name: BlatAlignmentsGbrowseUrl
textAttribute.help: Details of gene alignments to the non redundant collection of proteins (filtered by Genus) and ESTs from NCBI. Alignments shown in the genome browser (JBrowse).
